cinnamon.engine.utils

Class MutablePolygon

  • java.lang.Object
    • cinnamon.engine.utils.MutablePolygon
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Partitionable, Polygon

    public final class MutablePolygon
extends Object
implements Polygon

    Implementation of Polygon allowing for changes to the points that define the shape. A MutablePolygon has a minimum of 3 points.

    Created by chris on 6/28/2017.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MutablePolygon(int pointCount)
      Constructs a MutablePolygon with an expected number of points.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MutablePolygon

        public MutablePolygon(int pointCount)

        Constructs a MutablePolygon with an expected number of points.

        All points are initialized to (0,0) and a minimum of 3 points are required.

        Parameters:
        pointCount - number of points.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if pointCount < 3.

    • Method Detail

      • addCircle

        public void addCircle(MutableSphereBounds circle)

        Adds a Sphere as a tighter bounds.

        Parameters:
        circle - bounding circle.

      • addPoint

        public void addPoint(float x,
                     float y)

        Adds a point forming a line segment with the previously last point in the polygon.

        Parameters:
        x - x.
        y - y.

      • addPoint

        public void addPoint(int index,
                     float x,
                     float y)

        Adds a point at a given index.

        Parameters:
        index - point index.
        x - x.
        y - y.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if index < 0 or index >= point count.

      • applyTransform

        public void applyTransform(Transformation<Point> transformation)

        Applies a Transformation to all points.

        Parameters:

      • removePoint

        public void removePoint(int index)

        Removes a point at the given index.

        Parameters:
        index - point index.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if index < 0 or index >= 3.
        IllegalStateException - if point count would become < 3 after point removal.

      • setPoint

        public void setPoint(int index,
                     float x,
                     float y)

        Sets the x and y components of the point at a given index.

        Parameters:
        index - point index.
        x - x.
        y - y.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if index < 0 or index >= point count.

      • trim

        public void trim()

        Sheds excess capacity for points. This method should be called when the number of points is no longer expected to change.
